title: Hunter Biden says he only regrets not anticipating political blowback of his foreign work
text:
As the former vice president has remained a front-runner in the Democratic presidential field, Hunter Biden’s business dealings have been the target of conservatives and the president. Critics accuse the former vice president of forcing out a Ukrainian prosecutor who was said to have been investigating an oligarch linked to Burisma, though that investigation had been dormant, nor did it involve potential wrongdoing by Hunter Biden.

Moreover, the prosecutor’s ouster was widely backed by the international community and even Republicans in Congress at the time.

But Trump, with the help of his personal attorney Rudy Giuliani, has set to cast both roles as signs of corruption, and Trump's ask of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky this summer to investigate the Bidens has landed him in a scandal that has jeopardized his presidency.

Biden said that he had no regrets about joining Burisma, only that he did not foresee the potential political fallout of the move.

"I regret not taking into account that there would be a Rudy Giuliani and a president of the United States that would be listening to this ridiculous conspiracy idea which has again been completely debunked by everyone," he said.

Pressed by ABC’s Amy Robach about whether he should have anticipated the political storm now swirling, Biden got more defensive.

“You know what, I’m a human and you know what, did I make a mistake?” he asked. “Well maybe in the grand scheme of things. But did I make a mistake based upon some ethical lapse? Absolutely not.”
